comments.body:
does this work correctly when one of the object literal's property assignments is a shorthand? eg

```ts
const x = 1
module.exports = {
  x,
  extends: 'base',
  // ...
```

Later: Actually, I don't understand why this emits an object literal + `export=` when the previous test emits a series of top-level `export`s.
it's because `extends` isn't a valid identifier, so it can't be used as an export name. To work around that, we emit the less-nice `const` instead.
I've added a shorthand to the test ❤️
